page.title: 05Red Deer
page.content: Red Deer on Exmoor are never artificially fed,yet they still manage to find food by feeding on Ivy or raiding farm land.They have even been seen digging up snow to tear up roots of Ferns, and standing on their hind legs to nibble at the branches of trees.During summer they have a very large choice of vegetation. The best time to see a herd all together is in Spring when they leave the woods for the new grass. the deer are the largest animals remaining in Britain.Even if the hunter is after them they are still The most magnificent animals in our country.
